content: American comedian and actor **Ronny Xin Yi Chieng** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 钱信伊; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Qián Xìnyī*; born 1984/1985) is an American comedian and actor. He is a senior correspondent and rotating host on [Comedy Central](/wiki/Comedy_Central)'s *[The Daily Show](/wiki/The_Daily_Show)*, and he created and starred in the sitcom *Ronny Chieng: International Student*. He has also appeared in films such as *[Crazy Rich Asians](/wiki/Crazy_Rich_Asians)* and the English version of *[Inspector Sun and the Curse of the Black Widow](/wiki/Inspector_Sun_and_the_Curse_of_the_Black_Widow)*. Born in [Johor](/wiki/Johor), Malaysia, Chieng spent his youth there as well as in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). He graduated from [University of Melbourne](/wiki/University_of_Melbourne) in 2010 with a bachelor's degree in laws. Since 2012, he was active in the entertainment industry of Australia and the United States. In 2025, Chieng obtained [American citizenship](/wiki/Citizenship_of_the_United_States) and renounced his [Malaysian citizenship](/wiki/Malaysian_nationality_law), as Malaysia does not recognize [dual nationality](/wiki/Multiple_citizenship). ## Early life and education Chieng was born into a [Malaysian Chinese](/wiki/Malaysian_Chinese) family in [Johor Bahru](/wiki/Johor_Bahru), Malaysia. He does not celebrate his birthday and prefers to keep his date of birth private.[a] He grew up in both Singapore and the United States, living in [Manchester, New Hampshire](/wiki/Manchester,_New_Hampshire) from 1989 to 1994. In his youth, Chieng was a Singapore [Sea Scout](/wiki/Sea_Scout) of the [Singapore Scout Association](/wiki/Singapore_Scout_Association). When he lived in Johor Bahru, Chieng commuted to Fuchun Primary School in [Woodlands](/wiki/Woodlands,_Singapore), Singapore. He subsequently attended [Pioneer Secondary School](/wiki/Pioneer_Secondary_School) and [Jurong Pioneer Junior College](/wiki/Jurong_Pioneer_Junior_College). Thereafter, Chieng attended the [University of Melbourne](/wiki/University_of_Melbourne) in Australia. He lived at [Trinity College](/wiki/Trinity_College,_Melbourne) and graduated in 2010 with [Bachelor of Commerce](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Commerce) and [Bachelor of Laws](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Laws) degrees. He also obtained a [Graduate Diploma in Legal Practice](/wiki/Legal_Practice_Course) from the [Australian National University](/wiki/Australian_National_University) in 2012. ## Career In 2012, Chieng, alongside [Matt Okine](/wiki/Matt_Okine), won best newcomer at the [Melbourne International Comedy Festival](/wiki/Melbourne_International_Comedy_Festival) for his show *The Ron Way.* Chieng performed with [Trevor Noah](/wiki/Trevor_Noah) in 2013 at the *[Just for Laughs](/wiki/Just_for_Laughs)* comedy festival in Montreal. In 2015, he was asked to audition for the correspondent role on *The Daily Show*, which Noah hosted from 2015 to 2022. In July 2016, he was named one of 10 Comics to Watch by [*Variety*](/wiki/Variety_(magazine)). Three months later, he had a segment on *The Daily Show* in which he criticized a [Jesse Watters](/wiki/Jesse_Watters) clip on [Fox News](/wiki/Fox_News) deemed by many as racist. He also revisited New York City's [Chinatown](/wiki/Chinatown,_Manhattan) neighborhood, where Watters had mocked residents, and conducted more respectful interviews in [Mandarin](/wiki/Mandarin_Chinese) and [Cantonese](/wiki/Cantonese). The video went viral and received coverage in *[The Washington Post](/wiki/The_Washington_Post)* and on *[Slate](/wiki/Slate_(magazine))*. In 2017, Chieng began co-writing and starring in the sitcom *Ronny Chieng: International Student*, based on his own experience as a Malaysian student in Australia. It was developed for [Comedy Central](/wiki/Comedy_Central) in America and [ABC TV](/wiki/ABC_TV_(Australian_TV_channel)) in Australia. In 2018, he made his film debut in *[Crazy Rich Asians](/wiki/Crazy_Rich_Asians)*, as Eddie Cheng, an obnoxious banker. In 2019, his first stand-up special with Netflix, *Asian Comedian Destroys America!*, was released, directed by his *Daily Show* collaborator Sebastian DiNatale. In early 2021, Chieng signed a deal with Netflix for two additional stand-up specials and a "docu-comedy." He also appeared as the original character Jon Jon in the [Marvel Studios](/wiki/Marvel_Studios) film *[Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings](/wiki/Shang-Chi_and_the_Legend_of_the_Ten_Rings);* it was also announced that Chieng and DiNatale will co-write a martial arts action-comedy film for Sony. The new "docu-comedy", titled *Ronny Chieng Takes Chinatown*, was released in 2022. The film co-stars YouTuber [David Fung](/wiki/Fung_Brothers), with guest appearances from fellow *Shang-Chi* actor [Simu Liu](/wiki/Simu_Liu) and professional NBA player [Jeremy Lin](/wiki/Jeremy_Lin). Chieng's second Netflix special, *Speakeasy*, was released on 5 April 2022. In October 2022, Chieng commented on [Rishi Sunak](/wiki/Rishi_Sunak) becoming Britain's first Asian Prime Minister during a [*Daily Show*](/wiki/The_Daily_Show) segment. He said, "I know everyone is excited that this is the first Asian prime minister, but let's be clear: Indians are not Asians, OK? They're still people—great people—just not Asian people.” Many internet [netizens](/wiki/Netizen) have criticized the comment, particularly Indians. In July 2024, [Mayor of Honolulu](/wiki/Mayor_of_Honolulu), [Rick Blangiardi](/wiki/Rick_Blangiardi) signed a proclamation that 27 July, will be known as Ronny Chieng Day for his contributions to the entertainment industry, during Chieng's stay in [Honolulu](/wiki/Honolulu) for his *The Love to Hate It* tour. In November 2024, Chieng was featured in the lineup for [Comics Come Home](/wiki/Comics_Come_Home) 28 at TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts. Starting in [season 14](/wiki/King_of_the_Hill_season_14) of *[King of the Hill](/wiki/King_of_the_Hill)*, Chieng became the new voice of Kahn Souphanousinphone who was previously voiced in earlier seasons by [Toby Huss](/wiki/Toby_Huss). On 15 July 2025, Chieng and [Hasan Minhaj](/wiki/Hasan_Minhaj) announced *Hasan Hates Ronny | Ronny Hates Hasan*, a co-headlining North American tour. Minhaj has called Chieng a "sadistic pervert" because of his activities on [Instagram](/wiki/Instagram). In December 2025, Chieng made public service announcements on the [MTA](/wiki/Metropolitan_Transportation_Authority) [New York City Transit Authority](/wiki/New_York_City_Transit_Authority)'s [subway](/wiki/New_York_City_Subway) system, about the retirement of the [MetroCard](/wiki/MetroCard). ## Personal life Chieng has lived in New York City since moving back to the U.S. in 2015. He is married to Hannah Pham. The couple met and began dating while studying commerce and law at the [University of Melbourne](/wiki/University_of_Melbourne). Pham later obtained a master's degree in law at [New York University](/wiki/New_York_University) and worked as an attorney in the United States. Although Chieng lived in Australia for a decade, he does not have citizenship or permanent residency status there. In April 2025, Chieng became a United States citizen. He practices [Brazilian jiu-jitsu](/wiki/Brazilian_jiu-jitsu) and holds the rank of [blue belt](/wiki/Brazilian_jiu-jitsu_ranking_system). Chieng is an avid collector of watches, an interest that first began with a [Seiko](/wiki/Seiko) 5 that he purchased during his university years in Australia. His watch collection was featured on an episode of the [Hodinkee](/wiki/Hodinkee) series *Talking Watches* and includes a rare variant of the Seiko Chronograph Ref. 6139-6010 and a vintage [GMT-Master](/wiki/Rolex_GMT_Master_II) Ref. 16753 "Root Beer". Another of his watches, a two-tone Rolex dated to 1984 that he inherited from his late father, appeared on an episode of *[Antiques Roadshow](/wiki/Antiques_Roadshow_(American_TV_program))* and was valued at $5,000. ## Filmography ### Film YearTitleRoleNotes2018*[Crazy Rich Asians](/wiki/Crazy_Rich_Asians_(film))*Edison "Eddie" Cheng2021*[Wish Dragon](/wiki/Wish_Dragon)*Pipa God (voice)Animated
